text: Natalia Scherbakoff Takes Charge as Orion S.A. CTO [Dominic Sanders](https://investorshangout.com/profile/view?id=79424)Updated: 10-17-2024 04:35 PM Natalia Scherbakoff Takes Charge as Orion S.A. CTO Orion S.A. (NYSE: OEC), a leading global manufacturer in specialty chemicals, has recently announced the appointment of Natalia Scherbakoff as their new Chief Technology Officer. This move signifies a significant step as the company looks to enhance its innovation capabilities in sustainable materials and carbon black technologies. Transition in Leadership Scherbakoff succeeds David Deters, who has been at the helm of Orion's global innovation for nearly a decade. Under his guidance, the organization has emerged as a leader in producing sustainable materials and battery additives within the carbon black industry. Deters is set to retire at the end of 2024 but will remain with the company to ensure a smooth transition for Scherbakoff. Background and Experience Before joining Orion, Natalia Scherbakoff served as the Vice President of Technology & Innovation at Trinseo, where she managed global research and development initiatives with a strong focus on sustainability and circular solutions. Her experience also includes supporting key business growth initiatives, including mergers and acquisitions, which highlights her leadership capabilities and strategic vision. Vision for Innovation Orion's CEO, Corning Painter, expressed enthusiasm about Scherbakoff's appointment, stating, "Natalia has an impressive global experience and a remarkable track record in successfully bringing product ideas to market. Her blend of interpersonal skills and innovation drive is exactly what we need now at Orion." He anticipates that her presence will enhance the momentum built by Deters, particularly in the realms of battery technology and product applications. Academic Credentials and Multilingual Skills Scherbakoff holds a Ph.D. and M.Sc. in Macromolecular Science from Case Western Reserve University in the U.S., along with a degree in Chemical Engineering from Mauá Engineering University in Brazil. Additionally, she earned her MBA from the Getulio Vargas Foundation in Brazil. Notably, she is fluent in five languages, including English, French, Portuguese, Italian, and Russian, which showcases her multicultural competency and ability to connect with diverse teams around the world. Innovative Projects in Development Based in Orion’s primary innovation hub in Cologne, Germany, Scherbakoff will oversee its technical centers across China, South Korea, and the U.S. Her role will focus on further enhancing Orion's innovation capabilities through projects such as the new Battery Innovation Center in Cologne, equipped with advanced production and diagnostic tools. Moreover, Scherbakoff will lead an ambitious €12.8 million initiative aimed at developing a climate-neutral method for producing carbon black from alternative sources. This project benefits from €6.4 million in funding from the German government and European Union, and it aims to improve Orion's efficiency in utilizing circular feedstocks. About Orion S.A. Orion S.A. (NYSE: OEC) stands as a prominent global supplier of carbon black, catering to various industries including tire manufacturing, coatings, inks, batteries, and plastics. The company prides itself on its capability to meet specific customer requirements while delivering a wide range of high-performance products. With four innovation centers and 15 manufacturing plants worldwide, Orion is committed to applying its extensive knowledge to create sustainable solutions for its customers, promoting both innovation and environmental responsibility. Frequently Asked Questions What is the role of Natalia Scherbakoff at Orion S.A.? Natalia Scherbakoff has been appointed as the Chief Technology Officer to lead innovation and product development. What experience does Natalia bring to Orion S.A.? Scherbakoff has extensive experience in technology and innovation from her previous role at Trinseo and has a strong academic background. What are some of the projects Scherbakoff will oversee? She will manage projects including the new Battery Innovation Center and a €12.8 million climate-neutral carbon black production initiative. What does Orion S.A. specialize in? Orion S.A. specializes in the production of carbon black, used in various applications such as tires, coatings, and batteries. Where will Scherbakoff be based during her tenure? She will be based in Orion's main innovation hub located in Cologne, Germany.
